title: Of Good Works
text: Albeit that good works, which are the fruits of Faith, and follow after Justification, cannot put away our sins ... yet are they pleasing and acceptable to God in Christ, and do spring out necessarily of a true and lively Faith.
commentary: Article 12, “Of Good Works”, states: Albeit that good works, which are the fruits of Faith, and follow after Justification, cannot put away our sins . The commentary below is a concise study essay offering historical context, theological significance, and suggestions for further study. Historically this Article reflects the Reformation effort to retain the catholic tradition where it is scriptural while rejecting practices viewed as unscriptural. For modern readers, note how this Article shapes worship, preaching, and ethical teaching, and compare it with patristic sources and later Anglican commentators.
